documents.title: second man charged in murder investigation
text: a second man has been charged in connection with a murder in norwich last month .
steve stannard was found fatally wounded at a property in bowers avenue on saturday , 5 november .
veron antonio , 24 , from surrey , has been charged with assisting an offender .
he 's been bailed to appear at norwich magistrates ' court on 20 january 2017 .

documents.title: serious collision closes b1106 at elveden
text: emergency services , including the air ambulance , are at the scene of a serious collision on the b1106 at elveden .
police say the road is currently blocked , and is being closed from the elveden crossroads at the a11 , while an investigation gets under way at the scene .
two people are thought to have been injured in the collision , which was reported to police at 15:35 .

is coming live from norfolk tonight .

documents.title: community church is cooking with gas
text: do you remember our story earlier this week , about the christmas dinner cooker crisis facing a community church ?
it had a happy ending , following an appeal on bbc radio norfolk , when retailer john lewis stepped in with the offer of two new cookers .
they 've now been installed , and are up and running , at the alive house church on nelson street in norwich .
their community cafe serves 2,000 hot breakfasts a year , and will be providing meals over christmas .

documents.title: lifeboat launched after dog went into the sea 'chasing seals '
text: happisburgh lifeboat crew sprang into action when their pagers went off yesterday afternoon .
shortly before 14:00 , the coastguard told them of a dog and its owner in the sea at sea palling .
the spirit of berkhamsted was launched , with a crew of two , arriving at the scene within 15 minutes , and the search began .
a large number of seals have been seen in the area , and it 's believed the dog had gone into the sea after them .
luckily the owner and dog had both made it out of the sea , wet and cold .
they were checked over by the crew , and coastguard rescue team , and given advice .
happisburgh lifeboat then returned to station , in readiness for the next call .

it 'll be mild and frost free with lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
saturday will get off to a cloudy , misty and damp start with outbreaks of light rain and drizzle .
during the afternoon some more persistent rain will move in from the west , turning heavy at times with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .

documents.title: new power station for king 's lynn
text: the energy giant centrica is to build a new gas power station in king 's lynn on the site of the former one .
that was 20 years old ( and closed four years ago because it was no longer efficient , with the loss of 28 jobs .

the company says the new power station will be flexible in other words it will either be kept on all the time , or switched on and off , to fit in with peaks and troughs in production of power from renewable sources , such as wind and solar .
the plant will be capable of generating enough power for 370,000 homes .
building will start in the spring , with completion in 2019 .
once operational , it 's expected to create more than 30 jobs .

centrica has had planning permission to build a new power station in lynn ever since the old one closed , but said it had delayed investment because of high gas prices and uncertainty in the energy market .
author: Richard Bond
BBC Look East business correspondent

documents.title: balls ' gangnam dance a challenge for strictly singers
text: this year 's strictly come dancing on bbc tv is the best ever , say the stage singers .
but it 's not been without its challenges for the four band members , who perform live versions of the songs the contestants dance to on every show .
tommy blaize says the music and dancing have made it the best strictly so far , `` so it 's not really a chore '' .
but speaking of having to learn how to sing `` gangnam style '' for norwich boy ed balls and katya jones salsa , he said he `` had to turn the page around on stage to work out the lyrics '' .
any excuse to show the dance again !
it 's semi-final night this saturday on bbc one at 18:50 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: green councillor joins tories citing 'increasingly left-wing ideology '
text: a green councillor on norfolk county council has defected to the conservatives - strengthening their control of the authority .
councillor adrian dearnley , who represents thorpe hamlet in norwich , has been known to be unhappy with the greens for a while and was a supporter of the leave campaign in the eu referendum .

in a statement he said : `` i have for some time struggled with the direction [ the greens ] have taken , seemingly unable to separate environmental issues from an increasingly left-wing political ideology . ''
the green party says it is `` appalled '' by mr dearnley 's decision and it 's accused him of betraying his colleagues .

in a statement the party said : `` we are shocked that councillor dearnley would choose to throw in his lot with the conservative party , which over the last six years has overseen the systematic destruction of local government and the welfare system and left british people poorer and more divided . ''
councillor dearnley will sit with the conservatives for the first time at monday 's meeting of the full council .
he is not planning to stand for re-election in next may 's elections .
the political make-up of the council is now :
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: rugby : norfolk derby as diss take on norwich
text: two of the county 's top rugby teams clash in london league 2 north east this weekend .
diss are currently top of the table and have n't lost a home league game for almost three years .
visitors norwich are eighth , but won their last match against rochford hundred .
diss head coach dave smith said : `` i 've been in norfolk for 25 years and derby matches here are really big .
`` they 're always tight , we drew with norwich 3-3 last year . ''

BBC Radio Norfolk sport

text: over the years they 've raised thousands of pounds for charity , including £ 60,000 for the bbc children in need appeal .

documents.title: schoolchildren in race to space
text: pupils from five norfolk schools are competing against children in africa to see who can launch their un-manned `` spacecraft '' into the atmosphere .
the schools will use computers to track their balloon and send back high altitude images via a radio transmitter , when they launch in the spring .
the competition has been organised by the yellobric charity , which delivers e-learning facilities to pupils in south africa and ethiopia who may otherwise miss out on education .
the charity 's co-founder , gavin paterson , says interest in space travel has risen to a new level following british astronaut tim peake 's stint on the international space station .
the challenge is meant to be fun but the norfolk schools will see the benefits of partnering with schools in africa and gain a better understanding of each other 's lives . ''

documents.title: santa claus is back in town
text: look out there 's a santa about .
actually , there 'll be about 400 of them , dressed in red suits , fake beards and full of festive cheer .
the seasonal revellers will be running a 2km ( 1.2m ) course around norwich 's eaton park this sunday , in aid of the east anglia 's children 's hos ( each ) charity .

it 's the second time the charity has hosted the event and in honour of this , a gift-bearing father christmas will be there for any children taking part if they 've been good for the rest of the year , of course !

BBC Local Live

is that extra pint or glass of wine really worth increasing the risk of causing a serious collision or even death ?

documents.title: latest from court after vehicle was driven at pedestrians in car park
text: the case of a 43-year-old man has been committed to crown court , following an incident where a man was left with serious injuries after he was hit by a car and thrown up in the air .
darren blackmore , of cantley lane , norwich , appeared before norwich magistrates yesterday .
he 's been charged with wounding with intent , two counts of attempting to wound with intent and one count of driving a motor vehicle dangerously .
the incident took place in a car park in north walsham , shortly before 01:00 on 23 july .
mr blackmore , who has yet to enter a plea , was remanded in custody and he is due to appear at norwich crown court on 22 december .
sammi horner , 35 , of market place in north walsham appeared before magistrates in november charged with encouraging or assisting the commission of an indictable-only offence .
she has also yet to enter a plea and is due to appear at the crown court on the same date .

documents.title: doctor cleared of sexual assaults
text: a 50-year-old doctor from norwich has been cleared of a number of sexual assaults against women .
dr ashok singh , of turnberry , norwich , was facing charges of five counts of sexual assaults and five counts of indecent assault .
he was found not guilty on all charges at norwich crown court .

documents.title: domestic abuse is a crime taken very seriously by norfolk police
text: all of norfolk 's police officers are fully trained to deal with domestic abuse , and it 's a crime they take very seriously , while their priority , says det insp james brown , is the safety of the victim and their children .
`` we always see a slight rise in incidents at this time of year the pressures of christmas , alcohol , family tensions you put them all in one box and the tensions tend to flare up , '' he said .
det insp brown has been with the force for nearly 19 years , and has seen an increase in people 's confidence in reporting these crimes .
he says the police do all they can to gather evidence , including on mobile phones , texts , the internet , which they can present to the courts .
`` we encourage people to keep a diary of events , especially if they 're not ready to come forward to speak to us , '' he said .
the impact of domestic abuse on children is significant , he explains , whether witnessing it or hearing arguments , and can lead on to other issues for those children .
`` our message to victims , or those you suspect are being abused , is to keep safe , but have the confidence to come forward , tell someone .
`` if you can come forward and tell the police , be reassured we 'll take it seriously . ''
anyone in immediate danger is advised to call 999 and ask for the police .
the national domestic violence helpline is staffed 24 hours a day by female support workers and volunteers , and all calls are confidential : 0808 2000 247 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spotting the signs of domestic abuse
text: zoe harding is one of those who 've been trained to help people suffering domestic abuse .
zoe , who works for breckland council , says victims of domestic abuse do n't always approach official support services for help .
`` by having a highly-skilled workforce across the county , with a good knowledge of the signs and symptoms , we can be pro-active in identifying victims and offer support , '' she said .
she explains that some signs can be more subtle than others .
it 's not just bruises .
with emotional abuse people withdraw and change their behaviour , and the impact of domestic abuse on children is relevant so school staff may up on those signs too . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: linnets relishing role as fa trophy underdogs
text: king 's lynn town go to gateshead this weekend in the first round of the fa trophy .
the linnets are unbeaten in eight matches , but play two divisions below their opponents who are currently 12th in the national league .
king 's lynn player-coach sam gaughran told me `` it 's massive for the club , it 's going to be a great experience but we 're going there with no fear with the run we 're on at the moment . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: three games in seven days for the canaries
text: norwich city start a potentially pivotal week in their championship season at barnsley tomorrow .
the canaries also have home games against aston villa and huddersfield to come between now and next friday night .
city have an opportunity to make up for some of the ground they lost during their five-match losing streak which ended with a win over brentford last saturday .
anything less and the pressure would be back on manager alex neil .
barnsley are 12th in the championship and managed by paul heckingbottom ( who spent a season with norwich as a player 14 years ago .
we 'll bring you more from alex neil 's regular friday media conference at lunchtime .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: 'champions ' to spot domestic abuse
text: a project to train people to spot the signs of domestic abuse has recruited three times as many volunteers as first expected .
norfolk county council began the scheme in september 2015 to recruit 150 `` domestic abuse champions '' .
since then , more than 500 people who work in public services are now taking part .
these people , who are health , police , courts and education professionals , are trained to recognise the signs of abuse and to show people where they can get help .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nhs changes 'not about closing hospitals '
text: changes to the nhs service in the county are being looked at by councillors today .
the sustainability and transformation plan sets out a `` strategic direction '' for how health services could change .

wendy thomson , managing director of the county council , says that , if nothing was to change in norfolk 's health and social care system , in five years time there would be an overspend of £ 409m in just one year .
the conversation in norfolk , she adds , is not about closing hospitals .

roisin fallon-williams , chief executive of norfolk community health and care nhs trust ( nch & c ) ruled out amalgamating the clinical commissioning groups , after a member of the public said having five in the county is wasteful .
good things come from local commissioning all ccgs are collaborating and increasingly sharing resources . ''
author: Tom Baker
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: investigations continue into assault
text: no further action is to be taken against a man who was arrested earlier this week in connection with a serious assault in king 's lynn .
paramedics called police when they found a man with knife wounds on his arms and legs at a house in stanley street last friday evening .
a man in his 20s , from the london area , was arrested on tuesday .
no further action will now be taken against him and police investigations continue .

documents.title: appeal after cat gets caught in trap
text: ginger tom percy used up one of his nine lives , after getting his leg caught in a spring trap in norwich earlier today .
the rspca , alerted by a passer by , took the 15-year-old cat to the vets where the trap was removed .
it 's believed percy got caught in it near primrose crescent , sometime between 04:00 and 07:30 .
percy 's leg was not broken and he 's expected to make a full recovery .
spring traps are not illegal but their use is controlled by the pests act 1954 and the wildlife and countryside act 1981 .
owner helen holmes says percy was lucky , but she 'd like whoever is setting these traps to `` think about other animals that may get trapped another time a cat might not be so fortunate . ''
rspca inspector ben kirby says the traps should always be used responsibly , and anyone with information is asked to call them on 0300 123 8018 .

documents.title: photos travelling through time
text: did you know today was `` time traveller day '' ?
so on behalf of all the doctor whos out there , we thought we 'd travel back through the archives of photographic agency getty to see what we could find .

they 're all marked norfolk , but exactly where they were taken has not been recorded.on this day in 1960 , forestry workers bill cordy , jim flaxman , joe causton and tom dickson had been felling christmas trees for festive celebrations .
going back through time to december 1911 - when geese were being plucked for market .
but it was n't all about preparing for christmas .
these two demonstrators had been protesting outside the thor missile site in swaffham , when they were carried off by policemen in 1958 .

documents.title: long overdue library book
text: i felt guilty when my library book was overdue by three days but what if it had been 63 years ?
a pensioner clearing out the clutter in her attic discovered a book she 'd borrowed while she was a student at a school in north norfolk with a return date stamped for 1953 .
better late than never , though , so the pensioner decided to return the 1929 copy of travels with a donkey in the cevennes to north walsham high school .

school librarian liz sawyer says it was left outside the library door by a member of staff , with a little note saying it had been passed to her by a lady who used to come to the school and apologised for not bringing it back sooner .
the book , by robert louis stevenson describing his hiking trip in france , is quite fragile so wo n't be going back on the library shelf .
the school does n't have a fines policy for overdue books but then again , they 've never had one returned this late before .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

text: ymca norfolk has launched a home for christmas campaign which aims to help ensure that no young person in norfolk has to sleep on the street , in cars or on friends ' floors this christmas .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: have your say on third river crossing
text: it 's your chance to have your say on plans for a third river crossing in great yarmouth .
norfolk county council and local business organisations are trying to persuade the government to fund a new bridge across the river yare in the south of the town .
they argue it would ease delays and boost economic development .
consultation events are being held throughout the month and in january , with the first today at great yarmouth 's town hall .
@ twitterid is holding its first consultation event on the third river crossing .
until 4pm today at town hall # gy3rc

documents.title: six years in jail for sex attacker
text: a man has been given a jail term of more than six years after being convicted of attempting to rape a woman in great yarmouth .
paul stranks , 22 , of no fixed abode , was sentenced at norwich crown court after pleading guilty on 12 september .
a woman was attacked on temple road in great yarmouth , on sunday , 27 march .
she managed to scream before two members of the public dragged stranks off her , and he then fled and was arrested later .
he was sentenced to six years for the attempted rape and will have to serve a further four months on top of that for absconding from lawful custody while he was on remand and in hospital in norwich .
norfolk police said he was at large for 10 hours before he was located in london and re-arrested .
stranks was also placed on the sex offenders ' register for life .

documents.title: video : protest at plans to take away lollipop patrol
text: parents in norwich have been protesting at plans to get rid of a lollipop lady at a busy crossing on the outer ring road .
pupils from three schools use the crossing on colman road , but now it 's facing the axe .

norfolk county council has said it is consulting on cutting the crossing patrols at 38 sites which are deemed not dangerous enough under national safety criteria , and they can only afford to pay for patrols where they are really necessary .

documents.title: police constable charged with drink driving
text: a police constable has been charged with drink driving following an incident in catfield , near stalham .
officers stopped a vehicle on the a149 shortly before 02:00 on monday and arrested a woman after she failed a roadside breath test .
lorna stoker , 37 , a constable at north walsham police station , was taken into custody and later charged with drink driving .
she was released on bail and is due to appear at great yarmouth magistrates ' court on monday , 19 december .

documents.title: 'savage punch ' football manager now free to visit local pub
text: the manager of a football team who knocked an opposing player out cold , is now free to visit his local pub after a court ban was overturned by judges .
riley 's fc manager andrew marney was running the lines during an ill-tempered game , when tempers flared after a free kick was awarded to the norwich club .
marney charged onto the pitch , and decked a mettingham fc player with a savage punch , the appeal court heard .
his victim was emotionally and physically scarred by the attack , and needed plastic surgery to repair wounds to his mouth .
the 35-year-old , of morse road , norwich , was given a six month suspended sentence at norwich crown court in june , after he was convicted of assault causing actual bodily harm .
he was also ordered to pay his victim £ 500 , and banned from all licensed premises for six months .
marney challenged the ban , pointing out that alcohol had played no part in the attack .
his appeal was upheld at london 's court of appeal ( yesterday .

documents.title: boxer was a 'good man with so much love to give '
text: a boxer who died after suffering a knockout punch in his first fight was `` a good man '' .
a memorial mass at the catholic church of st mary 's in great yarmouth has been held for 22-year-old kuba moczyk .
father philip shryane , who led the mass , said kuba 's `` life was boxing '' .
`` this was his first fight and you know what happened .
he was a good man , shy and quiet , very polite and very gentle .
`` a young man with a good heart , with so much love to give and so much to look forward to always a gentle smile '' .
kuba , originally from poland , lived and worked in the seaside town .
his uncle , marcin smigaj , gave a tribute in polish , on behalf of the family .
kuba moczyk will be cremated later today .
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

kuba moczyk , 22 , suffered a head injury when he was knocked out in the third round of a bout at the tower complex in the seaside town last month .
mr moczyk 's family were at his bedside when he died .
his heart was donated to help others .

documents.title: no regrets over retirement for jono drane
text: norwich paralympian jono drane says that winning a medal would n't change his life .
the 29-year-old competed in the -81kg judo in rio this summer , and previously won a bronze in the world championships .
drane left the sport earlier this week , and told bbc radio norfolk that he expects to miss training alongside equally passionate athletes .

documents.title: witness appeal to a149 three-vehicle collision
text: the police would like to hear from anyone who saw a road traffic collision involving three vehicles on the a149 at snettisham .
a green suzuki alto , a black jaguar and a toyota gr8 were involved in the incident shortly before 17:15 at the junction with station road on thursday , 1 december .
the suzuki driver was taken to the queen elizabeth hospital , where she remains in a critical but stable condition .
the driver of the jaguar was also taken to hospital to be treated for minor injuries .
the toyota driver was treated at the scene .

documents.title: drug-taking scaffolder 'deserved ' prison term
text: a scaffolder from norfolk who got caught up in a brawl at an illegal rave in lincolnshire has lost an appeal against his prison sentence .
joshua jake colman , 22 , of dennys walk , narborough , had taken a cocktail of drugs and alcohol .
he was seen throwing at least five stones at police officers who were trying to break up the event , at twyford woods , near bourne in lincolnshire , in may 2015 .
the 22-year-old had admitted violent disorder and was jailed for 18 months at lincoln crown court in july .
colman had appealed against his sentence , but was told by judges at the court of appeal yesterday that he deserved what he got for his part in the `` drug and drink-induced mindlessness '' .

documents.title: poultry farmers 'the poor end of farming '
text: a poultry farmer in west norfolk says the government should help the industry set up biosecurity measures to prevent an outbreak of avian flu .

this week , the department for environment , food and rural affairs issued an order to anyone with chickens , turkeys and ducks to keep them indoors for 30 days , following the discovery of a highly infectious strain on influenza in mainland europe .
karen field has 200 free-range chickens on her farm at terrington st john , and says it will be a struggle for many farmers to put the measures in place quickly .
she said : `` you need a month at least to do it securely .
for someone like us who runs a complete free range unit , we have n't got the sheds '' .
the government should help the farmers , hand them the netting , tarpaulin and the products to do it so we do n't have to find the major outlay .
a lot of people in poultry do n't have the money , we 're the poor end of farming . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: south norfolk 'one of the worst ' places for those struggling to conceive
text: an ivf campaign group has named south norfolk as one of the worst places to live for `` gold standard '' fertility treatment on the nhs .
the south norfolk clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) took the decision to cease funding for its level 3 fertility service in november 2015 .
essex was named as the worst place for those struggling to conceive , by the campaign group fertility fairness .
greater manchester came out as the best location .

now south norfolk councillors have chosen to defer making a decision on the matter following complaints from villagers in dickleburgh that the idea is dangerous , especially so close to a school .
developer 's hopkins homes came up with the proposal after it said there was not enough space for a raised walkway .
councillors decided other options should be explored before a decision is made .

documents.title: getting poultry indoors will take at least a week , says farmer
text: earlier we told you about government advice to try and stop avian flu spreading to england .
a norfolk farmer says the precautionary measures are a `` nightmare '' and impossible to bring about overnight .
poultry keepers have been told to keep their birds indoors for 30 days or take steps to separate them from wild birds .
the department for environment , food and rural affairs says this applies to anyone who keeps birds , even those with a few chickens in their back garden .
karen field runs a smallholding at terrington st john in west norfolk with 200 birds and is having to build an indoor shelter .
`` we ca n't just have them in a netted pen , '' she said .
`` the roofs must be covered with tarpaulin or plastic to prevent wild bird feaces from dropping through and infecting them .
`` it 's a nightmare because i have breeding birds and i ca n't mix all my males together because they will fight . ''
ms field says to do the task properly will take at least a month , and she will be lucky if it 's completed in a week .

documents.title: rare victorian post cart restored
text: a man from march has restored a 100-year-old royal mail wheelbarrow .
colin bedford revived the cart after it was found in a barn in heacham in norfolk .
the very rare victorian barrow was used in the 1900s by postmen in the fens .
it was donated to the march veteran and vintage cycle club with a gas lamp on the front , equipped with a truncheon to fight off mail thieves .

documents.title: thieves try to steal cash machine using sports car
text: two thieves used a sports car to try and rip a cash machine from outside a shop near downham market , police say .
it happened at about 19:00 on friday , at costcutter on church drove in outwell .
one man threatened shop staff with a knife , whilst another tied a canvas strap around the cash machine before attaching it to a sports car and then driving off to try and rip it out .
they failed but did steal money from the shop till .
police want to hear from any witnesses to the robbery .

text: a fourth man has been arrested by police investigating the murder of steve stannard last month .
the man , aged in his 30s , was arrested in the croydon area yesterday on sus of conspiracy to supply controlled drugs and fraud .
the arrest comes after mr stannard received fatal stab wounds in bowers avenue , norwich , shortly before 14:30 on 5 november .
the man has been released on bail .

a spokeswoman confirmed the number has increased since the report of one case being investigated last week .
norfolk constabulary is one of 21 forces across the country liaising on operation hydrant , the central hub co-ordinating police inquiries into the allegations of non-recent child abuse accusations .
more than 350 people , nationally , have come forward to say they are victims .

documents.title: white line proposed instead of path near school
text: a housing developer in south norfolk could get the go-ahead today to paint a white line on a lane for pedestrians , instead of putting in a pavement .
hopkins homes wants to build 22 houses on harvey lane in dickleburgh , near the primary school .
a pavement was in the original plans , but now a painted white line which would be for walking on is being proposed instead .
alex blanshard , a mother , said : `` we expect the council to look after our children .
we need to get our children walking and cycling to school .
`` the proposal does nothing of that and it 's absolute madness that in 2016 that 's the best we can do because the focus is on houses . ''
but simon bryan , from hopkins homes , says the plans are in accordance with local planning rules .

`` these improvements include widening the road , creating a new footpath over half the length of the improvements , and where we are constrained we are defining pedestrian margins and installing road signage to improve pedestrian safety , '' he said .

documents.title: vehicle hits railway bridge
text: a vehicle almost ended up on railway tracks after hitting a wall last night , police say .
norfolk police says it 's investigating after receiving reports of a vehicle , believed to be a lorry , crashing into the wall of the bridge near wymondham .
it hit the bridge , which goes over the mid norfolk railway line , at the junction of chapel lane and tuttles lane at about 22:00 .
no-one was injured but the driver has not yet reported the incident .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: gas rig worker dies on north sea platform
text: an offshore gas rig worker has died following an incident in the north sea .
parenco uk limited , which has a base at the bacton gas terminal , says the man died on board its 23a gas platform 70 miles off the norfolk coast .
the platform has been closed and gas supplies halted .
the company says it 's `` working closely with the health and safety executive and other relevant authorities '' to investigate the circumstances in which the man died .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: man from london arrested over king 's lynn stabbing
text: a 20-year-old man from london has been arrested over a stabbing in king 's lynn last week .
paramedics called police when they found a man with knife wounds on his arms and legs at a house in stanley street on friday evening .
the victim was taken to the queen elizabeth hospital for treatment to non-life threatening injuries and has now been discharged .
a man was arrested yesterday over the attack .
author: Jo Thewlis
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: food banks : some people 'have n't eaten for days '
text: some people using food banks in norfolk have not eaten for `` two or three days '' , it has been claimed .
hannah worsley , project manager at norwich food bank , says demand is growing and she expects the food bank to give out 1,000 parcels this month , compared to around 600 on a normal month .
meanwhile , volunteers in great yarmouth say there has been a 300 % rise in demand for food parcels since august .

ms worsley said : `` we do have people that get their food parcel and literally rip it open and start eating some of the things straight away , because they 've waited and waited hoping things are going to improve for them . ''
`` they 're coming to us having eaten no food at all for two or three days . ''

documents.title: food banks report rise in need
text: there are concerns that delays in benefits have meant more people are using food banks in norfolk .

nick hewitt , who volunteers at a food bank in great yarmouth , says people who would normally cope on benefits are reporting that delays and issues with amounts being paid out in universal credit have caused them to turn to food banks .
mr hewitt says demand has gone up , with some people coming to the food bank for the first time .
`` they 've not been before and this is really happening a lot more now because of the universal credits situation , and the delay that people have in getting that money , '' he said .
the department for work and pensions says the reasons for using food banks is `` complex '' and should n't be put down to one issue .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: cromer tennis club given wimbledon lawnmowers
text: cromer tennis club has been given two lawnmowers that have cut grass at wimbledon .
the all england club presented the machines following a visit earlier this year .

matthew jordan , groundsman at the cromer club , said : `` we have the lta ( lawn tennis association ) come out once a year for an inspection and one of the things they look at is updating your machinery .
`` as our current lawnmower is 12 years old they thought it would be nice to gift us two of theirs .
a club of this size ca n't afford to buy two new ones , so it 's very much appreciated . ''
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: lock up your chickens
text: poultry owners , from farmers to people with a few chickens in their garden , will have to keep the birds indoors for the next 30 days following an order by the government as a precaution against bird flu .
a virulent strain of avian flu has killed wild birds across europe and it 's feared migrating species may bring it here .
mark gorton , a free range chicken producer near attleborough , says it 's a sensible move .
`` there 's a huge risk posed to us at the moment , '' he said .
`` we 've been tracking this strain of bird flu across europe for the last four or six weeks and it seems to be getting ever closer to the uk , with the nearest case recently in calais . ''
author: Jo Thewlis
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: great yarmouth celebrates 70 years of going to the dogs
text: a greyhound stadium is charging 1946 prices to celebrate its 70th anniversary .
among other offers , punters at yarmouth stadium will be charged just five pence for their first pint of beer at tonight 's meeting .
the norfolk stadium has bucked the national trend of greyhound stadium closures over recent years , with venues in england dropping from around 80 to 25 over the past 65 years .
but yarmouth owner stephen franklin believes the sport is gaining a growing audience .
`` races are now starting in the mornings and being streamed for an international audience and with online betting it will lead to more future success , '' he said .
yarmouth stadium has provided a livelihood for four generations of the franklin family .
holiday makers were the back bone of the business up until the 80s , and today it 's still one of the town 's biggest evening attractions .
look east will be joining in the celebrations live from the track this evening .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

norwich were also victims of two controversial decisions .
city played most of the match with 10 men after a ben godfrey red card , and carlton morris had a goal disallowed .
it is a real shame .
we would n't mind if we 'd have been outclassed or beaten easily , but we 've lost it on a few big decisions that have n't gone our way . ''

documents.title: hush norfolk 's rail stations are among the quietest in britain
text: ssssh keep it quiet , but did you know norfolk has three of the quietest railway stations in the east of england ?

figures from the office of rail and road ( orr ) estimate there were over 2.9bn entries and exits in rail stations across great britain in 2015/16 , an increase of 5 % compared with the previous year .
but that footfall was n't reflected at three stations in norfolk , which have the lowest numbers in the east of england .
buckenham , in the broadland area , ( came in at second place , with a recording of 134 journeys .
in fourth and fifth place respectively , were spooner row , in south norfolk - 664 - and eccles road , breckland , with 824 .
the quietest , both for the east of england - and in britain - is just over the border in cambridgeshire .
shippea hill saw the grand total of 12 entries and exits .

documents.title: former police officer 's crimes 'unforgiveable '
text: norfolk police launched an investigation into ben staff in 2012 , after a complaint was made about his business practices .
staff , of lucas court , norwich , was arrested in 2014 .
at norwich crown court yesterday , the former police officer , who resigned from the force in 2008 , was found guilty of fraud by false representation and converting criminal property .

at an earlier trial at king 's lynn crown court in march , the 35-year-old was convicted of two counts of fraud , two counts of false accounting , one count of converting criminal property and one count of fraudulent trading in relation to businesses .
deputy chief constable nick dean says the offences were `` very serious '' , and the fact that staff traded on the reputation of the police was `` absolutely unforgiveable '' .
staff will be sentenced at norwich crown court on 3 january .

documents.title: former police officer guilty of £ 1m fraud
text: a former norfolk police officer has been found guilty of a £ 1m fraud .
ben staff , of lucas court , norwich , used his reputation as an ex-policeman to gain the trust of victims and then used money intended for business accounts to fund his lavish lifestyle .
staff , 35 , bought an audi a6 , a bmw , paid for holidays and renovations to his home and funded his wedding .
he was convicted of six charges at king 's lynn crown court in march , and found guilty of two further charges at norwich crown court yesterday .
his wife , catriona staff , 33 , also a police officer , was cleared on all counts .

documents.title: hickling broad : a 'national jewel '
text: the norfolk wildlife trust ( nwt ) owns a substantial amount of the wetland nature reserve , hickling broad , but does n't own it in its entirety .
more than 1,400 acres of reedbeds , grazing marsh , open water and woodland makeup the hickling broad national nature reserve .
the nwt restored the wetland habitat , which has become a year-round haven for threatened wildlife such as swallowtail butterflies , marsh harriers and bitterns (
the hickling broad estate was put up for sale in september .
an appeal by the nwt to help them raise £ 1m to secure its purchase has seen £ 128,000 raised within its first week .

head of development at the nwt , nik khandpur admits they 're `` up against a tight time frame '' to buy the `` most expensive single land purchase in the trust 's history it 's early days and we have almost 90 % of the £ 1m still to raise '' .
the purchase would be a `` fitting legacy '' to their 90th celebrations , adds nwt chief executive brendan joyce .
this is a national jewel and if we secure it now we will be protecting its rare and endangered wildlife , and also making the best use of the broad for all the people who love and use it . ''

documents.title: money rolls in for hickling broad
text: an appeal by the norfolk wildlife trust ( nwt ) to help it complete its ownership of hickling broad has raised nearly £ 130,000 in its first week .
in september , 655 acres of the hickling broad estate were put on the open market .
the nwt reached an agreement to buy the land , and half of the broad , which makes up almost half of its national nature reserve , for £ 2.5m .
funding of £ 1.5m has already been secured , and the nwt needs a further £ 1m to buy the wetland , an important area for wildlife .
since the appeal was launched in 18 november , donations of £ 128,000 have rolled in .
hickling , the largest of the broads , has been privately-owned by the same family for two centuries .
it 's been in the care of the nwt since 1945 .

documents.title: nathan redmond set for carrow road return
text: former norwich city forward nathan redmond will face his former team mates this january , as southampton go to carrow road in the fa cup .
it will be the first time redmond will have returned to the club .
the match will take place on the weekend of the 6th-9th of january .
redmond transferred to southampton in the summer for around £ 11 million after the canaries were relegated from the premier league .
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: gorleston fc through in cup after goalkeeper 's father dies
text: gorleston have been allowed to progress to the fourth round of the fa vase .
the greens ' third round match at home to basildon was called off on saturday when a spectator , the father-in-law of gorleston goalkeeper taurean molloy , collapsed and died while watching .
their opponents basildon were winning 1-0 when the game was abandoned with about five minutes to go .
if both teams agreed , the match would have been replayed .
gorleston had come to the decision that they were prepared to repeat the game .
however , the essex side have forfeited the encounter .
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: matt jarvis set for canaries return
text: norwich city midfielder matt jarvis could play for the first time since summer in the checkatrade trophy tonight .
the canaries host swansea in the last 32 of the competition .
mostly under-23s will feature in the match , however first team players such as timm klose , josh murphy and steven whittaker could find themselves in the starting xi .
jarvis has been out since summer due to a knee injury .
author: Jay Lawrence
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: house closed following complaints of needles and anti-social behaviour
text: police have carried out a closure order on a property in great yarmouth after receiving numerous complaints about anti-social behaviour .
the closure , on a house in glanville road , was the first closure order to be carried out by officers from the great yarmouth operational partnership ( opt ) .
the order , granted by great yarmouth magistrates ' court yesterday , lasts for three months .
sgt julie johnson says the property `` posed a potential risk to the local community '' , and was in close proximity to a school .
we 'd had complaints of hypodermic needles being found in the area and had concerns for the children and residents .
should the occupants return whilst this order is in place they will be arrested . ''

documents.title: sus of cats being poisoned
text: pet owners in caister-on-sea fear their animals may have been poisoned following the deaths of several cats recently .
lesley bacon 's cat fugly ( has been in the intensive care unit at the vets for over a week now , with 25 % kidney function and she says the prognosis does n't look good .
the vet has told her fugly 's kidney problems happened very quickly , leading lesley to believe her pet had been poisoned .
a fortnight ago , fugly 's sister pudding had to be put down after crawling home with limp legs and body , and had fits .
she was believed to have either been poisoned , or hit by a vehicle

lesley , who 's facing a vet 's bill of up to four figures , says nearby pet owners have told her about 11 cats that have died suddenly in the last few weeks , and believes the number could be up to 15 .
it 's a coincidence all these cats have died at the same time it 's a crime to ill-treat an animal , it 's a slow , lingering death with the body 's organs slowly shutting down . ''

documents.title: 'most greyhounds do n't make the grade '
text: tomorrow night the yarmouth stadium is celebrating 70 years of greyhound racing at the track .
not everyone is in favour of the sport , and some have called for it to be banned .
hayley pattrick , from the norfolk greyhound rescue says greyhounds were n't born to race , it 's humans that make them do so .
`` yes they love to run , but you like to do things when you like to do them , not when you 're made to do them '' .
not all greyhounds that are bred to race make it , leaving a number of dogs needing to be re-homed .
a lot of the dogs , perhaps 80 % bred into the industry , do n't make the grade - they end up in the rescue if they 're very lucky , but the rest of them are euthanised . ''

documents.title: racetrack owner defends criticism of greyhound racing
text: great yarmouth 's stadium celebrates 70 years of greyhound racing tomorrow , and the track has hosted thousands of dogs over the years .
three generations of the franklin family , which founded the racetrack , still run the stadium .
it 's a controversial sport , with some calling for it to be banned because of how the dogs are treated .

stephen franklin , whose father len held his first races there in 1940 , says he 's never come across a trainer that he 'd say was cruel : `` we 've had meetings since 1940 with a vet on site and we 've never raced without a veterinary surgeon being on the course . ''
to mark the 70th anniversary , prices at tomorrow 's meeting will be dropped back 70 years .
stephen , grandson of the founder len , says race-goers will be able to get in for `` two and thruppence , have a drink for a shilling and buy a race card for a shilling '' .
he reckons `` two and thruppence '' is about 11.25p , but with no quarter pence piece in existence , they 'll probably round it up - `` 20p sounds fairer '' .
stephen 's grand-daughter paige is the fourth generation of the family to work at the stadium , after recently finishing a business degree .
so will the stadium still stand in 70 years time ?
we 've all come here from when we were born and we 've loved it we 've been brought up in it and it 's what we know . ''

documents.title: roll on two o'clock
text: as i scrolled through twitter this morning , this tweet from king 's lynn 's sad face otter made me laugh
looking forward to 2 o'clock when i get a break from all that fog .
it will be missed

BBC News

documents.title: from wimbledon to cromer
text: they 've cut the grass at the most famous tennis club in the world , and now they 're heading to norfolk .
the all england club , which manages wimbledon , has gifted two lawnmowers to the cromer lawn tennis and squash club .
with 10 grass courts to maintain , the surfaces come in for a lot of wear and tear .
when the tennis season is in full swing , and a tournament is on , the rye grass is cut and marked every day .
even out of season , it 's clipped , sprayed and fertilised .
this , says groundsman matt jordan , is why cromer is in the top six clubs for grass courts in the country .
he and fellow groundsman peter cooper will be taking ownership of the wimbledon mowers in january .

the north norfolk club has welcomed many famous players over the years , including multiple doubles grand slam winner and gb davis cup champion jamie murray , and dan evans who 's also a davis cup champion .
other names who 've played at the club include winston churchill 's wife , and wimbledon champion ann jones .

documents.title: watch out , the gritters are out
text: with overnight temperatures falling , norfolk 's gritters will be in action tonight .
dense freezing fog is forecast , and the met office has issued a yellow warning from 18:00 until 09:00 tomorrow , advising drivers to plan ahead and think about possible delays .
cold enough for the gritters to go out on all county gritting routes from 6pm .
could be foggy overnight too so take care # norfolkwinter

documents.title: weather : cold overnight with freezing fog
text: a dry night with widespread frost and fog , it could be freezing fog in places , as temperatures fall to around -2c ( 28f ) .
it 'll be a cold start to tuesday with the fog slow to clear and in parts of the region it could linger all day .
where the fog eventually lifts it 'll generally be cloudy with the chance of a few sunny intervals and highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: your chance to get transport issues off your chest
text: if you 've got any thoughts about transport issues in great yarmouth , and how a proposed third river crossing might affect people , norfolk county council wants to hear from you .

it 's launched a public consultation , and is holding a number of events throughout december and january where people can talk to council representatives about the proposal for a third bridge across the yare , as well as wider transport needs for the town .
last month , the county council carried out traffic surveys in the town .
the information gathered will be added to the consultation , which the council says is intended to help support their case for more investment in transport infrastructure in the area .

documents.title: one third of gp vacancies unfilled
text: a senior doctor in norwich says something needs to be done now about the recruitment crisis facing gps .
a survey out today by the bma shows that the east of england is the worst in the country when it comes to filling vacancies at practices .
over the last year , 35 % of surgeries have been unable to fill vacancies , compared to the national average of 31 % .
dr simon cooke is chairman of the onenorwich project , which is bringing 23 practices in norwich together .

we have to do something now because if we carry on in the current trajectory that we are , then general practice is not sustainable in fact i do n't think the whole health care system is sustainable . ''

documents.title: ndr : overnight closure of b1149 holt road
text: the b1149 holt road at horsford will be closed from 19:00 tonight , until no later than 06:00 tomorrow .
it 's to allow anglian water to complete a water main diversion at the site of the new drayton lane roundabout. , for the northern distributor road .
access in and out of horsford at the southern end of the village will be via church street and the a140 cromer road .

documents.title: charity appeal helps family enjoy christmas
text: thousands of people are helped every year by the salvation army and bbc radio norfolk 's toys and tins appeal .
and this year , it 's enjoying better support than ever with donations coming in daily at here at the forum , or at salvation army citadels across the county .
debbie , who has a son and daughter , is one of those who 's been helped by the campaign , following a dramatic change in circumstances .
her marriage had broken down , and she was left in debt with christmas approaching .
debbie said the appeal allows every family and child to experience the joy of christmas , and forget about `` whatever is going on in their life '' .
they get a lovely gift and a nice meal and can have a really lovely family day .
i 'm very passionate about my family and the thought of a family not having anything or being able to celebrate the joy of christmas gets to me . ''

documents.title: approval given for housing estates
text: west norfolk borough council 's planning committee has approved several housing developments .
an estate of 77 homes , including 15 housing association houses , will be built on an old industrial estate at docking .
the granaries site on station road has lain unused for years .
across the river from king 's lynn in west lynn , plans for 44 new dwellings have been approved .
residents had objected to the development , saying their school and roads would be seriously overcrowded if the estate was built .
councillors were accused of including too few bungalows in the plans for the lynnsport housing developments today .
the latest phase of 89 homes along greenpark avenue has been agreed , with work to establish new wildlife areas and open space starting in springtime .
the decision for a new lidl supermarket at heacham was deferred .
councillors were told that talks about the design of the building were still going on .

documents.title: welder strikes gold
text: despite burning his hand quite badly on the second day of a three-day competition , welder josh peek soldered on to become the best in europe .
the 20-year-old from norwich was awarded a gold medal at the euroskills finals in gothenburg , in front of a crowd of 10,000 at the closing ceremony in the swedish city yesterday .
more than 500 competitors from 28 nations across the continent were competing in a range of disciplines from beauty to bricklaying , cooking to carpentry , plumbing , plastering and web design .
josh , who aims to have a quiet christmas , will then get back into training and hopes to be selected for the worldskills international finals next october in abu dhabi .
i set my gloves alight - that hurt but i just got on with the job .
when i heard the words 'gold goes to the united kingdom ' i was totally stunned . ''

documents.title: your photos of frosty norfolk
text: many of us woke up to a cold and frosty morning , and it 's still cold out there with temperatures peaking at 8c ( 46f ) .
our bbc weather watchers were up and about , to capture sights from around the county :

documents.title: cargo vessel runs aground
text: a 3,000 tonne cargo vessel has run aground seven miles off the north east norfolk coast .
the muros , a general cargo vessel , with nine crew on board , was travelling between the tees and rochefort in south west france when she hit the haisborough sands early on saturday morning .
humber coastguard has told me the vessel is upright and intact , and `` there 's no immediate problem out there '' .

they say their priority is to get the ship off the sandbank , but it 's too early for them to say whether she 'll need to be towed into harbour for repairs or whether the vessel will be able to continue her voyage once she 's been refloated .
it 's not known what caused the vessel to run aground , and an investigation will be carried out by the uk government 's marine accident investigation bureau .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: happy ending to christmas cooker crisis
text: now back to our story of the race against time to find an oven to to cook a christmas lunch for 50 this week , and throughout the festive season .
the old six-burner cooker at the alive house church on nelson street , norwich had been condemned , with replacement parts expected to cost thousands of pounds .
within minutes of an appeal on bbc radio norfolk earlier , more than £ 700 had been donated , and two new cookers had been donated by the retailer john lewis .
the department store dipped into its charitable fund with an offer of £ 150 , to enable the overnight delivery of the new cookers .
the fitter who 'd condemned the old oven has volunteered to install them .

text: the met office has issued a warning of fog , including some locally dense freezing fog patches with visibility of less than 100m this evening and overnight .
yellow warning of fog for east of england

documents.title: hoping for a christmas miracle
text: if the thought of cooking christmas dinner fills you with dread , spare a thought for jo thorne .
jo , from the alive house community church , .
is preparing for a big party but her cooker 's gone kaput !
this wednesday , 50 community leaders and church ministers have been invited to enjoy an early christmas lunch as a thank you for their hard work over the last year .
but the cooker at the nelson street church and food bank distribution centre has been written off , and parts to replace it could cost £ 10,000 .
jo , who 's says she 's `` slightly panic stricken '' says they desperately need two new standard domestic double ovens , to meet health and hygiene regulations .
we 're starting our busiest season , we have to cook food bank meals , christmas meals and cook on christmas day so people are not alone .
it would be amazing if someone could help us through . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county council looking to make 'best use of money '
text: cuts to the county 's care budget could have a real impact on vulnerable people in norfolk , warns a charity that helps young people .
norfolk county council is looking at saving a further £ 4.5m from adult social services over the next three years , around 40 % of its budget .

catherine underwood , the acting executive director of adult social services , says the council has been working closely with district colleagues and service providers to think through how to get the best outcomes for people who need support .

`` we 're working really hard in norfolk to make sure that with £ 1m a day we 're able to spend it in the best way we can but that does mean changing some of the things that we 've been used to and handling some risks differently '' .

i think there will be changes in what we fund and i want to make sure we understand how to get the best use of money for vulnerable people , targeting those who really need it our responsibility is to get this right for norfolk . ''

documents.title: brass band and tree festival ends 50th anniversary year
text: st george 's catholic church on sprowston road in norwich rounds off its 50th anniversary year of celebrations with its first ever christmas tree festival and brass band christmas concert from saturday , december 10 to monday , december 12 .

text: king 's lynn town have appointed players lee stevenson and sam gaughran to the coaching staff at the walks .
stevenson will be assistant manager with defender gaughran taking on the role of first team coach .
the pair have been helping manager gary setchell since previous assistant manager gary mills left to take over at corby town in october .
the linnets have won six and drawn one of their last seven games .
new back room team at the walks

documents.title: charity for young homeless raises concerns at funding cuts
text: plans to cut millions of pounds from the county 's care budget have worried a charity that helps young people .

norfolk county council , where the conservatives are the largest party , is looking to reduce its budget that helps people in so-called supported accommodation , which includes those in sheltered housing as well as the young homeless .
the benjamin foundation helps around 100 young people with nowhere to live at any one time .
its director of housing and homelessness , matt garrod , says they understand the council is facing a challenging time , but hopes they can safeguard essential services .
`` there 's some potentially drastic cuts being proposed with a figure of around £ 4.5m , which would have significant implications , not just for us . ''

our services are a lifeline for young people , those who 've had a challenging period in their lives i fully appreciate some services may need to be remodelled but those services ca n't be taken away . ''

documents.title: cricket : norfolk name new one-day captain for 2017
text: norfolk county cc has appointed ashley watson as the new captain of their one-day side for next summer .
he replaces chris brown who will concentrate on skippering the three-day minor counties championship team .
32-year-old watson , who plays his club cricket for norwich , made his debut for the county as a 17-year-old .
key announcement at nccc agm with chris brown re-appointed as captain for 2017 with ashley watson taking over as one day captain
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: 'i 've been waiting for that ' says norwich city 's alex pritchard
text: norwich city star alex pritchard marked his best performance so far for the canaries with his first league goal for the club .
the former tottenham player was named man of the match in the impressive 5-0 win over brentford at carrow road after being chosen ahead of wes hoolahan..
it was only pritchard 's fourth league start for city .
the 23-year old arrived at carrow road in the summer and said he was pleased to show what he can do .
`` it 's a good day for me and i 've been waiting for that .
it 's been a slow start but it 's not always easy coming to a team and just flying off , '' he said .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: 'one swallow does n't make a summer ' warns city boss
text: norwich city finally returned to winning ways at the weekend , thrashing brentford 5-0 at carrow road to move back up to seventh in the championship .
it was their first win since mid-october and ended a run of five straight league defeats .
jacob murphy , graham dorrans , robbie brady , nelson oliveira and alex pritchard scored the goals .
manager alex neil said his side have now set the standard he requires for the rest of the season .
`` one swallow does n't make a summer , '' he said .
`` i just want to make sure this is the beginning of a good run and we can put that horrendous november to bed , because it certainly was n't a nice time for me or anybody else . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport
